content:
I can imagine how awe-inspiring it must have been to see the Triceratops fossil up close! It's indeed mind-boggling to think about the history and significance of such ancient creatures. The fact that you got to learn more about the fossil's acquisition and history through Rachel's guided tour must have added a rich layer of context to your experience.

I completely agree with you about the exhibit design. A well-curated exhibit can make all the difference in creating an immersive and engaging experience for visitors. The combination of lighting, displays, and overall design can transport you to a different time and place, making the experience even more memorable.

It's great that you appreciated the attention to detail in the exhibit's design. Sometimes, it's the little things that can make a big difference in how we engage with and remember an exhibit.

Did you find yourself learning anything new or surprising during the tour, or was there a particular fact or insight that stood out to you?
